englishTranslationText: Like	pearls	safely	hidden.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jaise	chupe	rakhe	huwe	moti

englishTranslationText: The	reward	for	what	they	did.
romanUrduTranslationText: Sila	unke	a’amāl	ka

arabicText: لَا يَسْمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغْوًۭا وَلَا تَأْثِيمًا
englishTranslationText:
They	will	not	hear	any	useless	speech	in	
it,	or	any	sin.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Us	meiñ	na	suneñge	koi	bekār	bāt	na	
guneh-gāri

englishTranslationText: Except	the	saying,	“Peace,	peace.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Hāñ	yeh	kehna	hoga	salām	salām

englishTranslationText:
And	those	on	the	right	-	how	(fortunate)	
are	those	on	the	right!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	dehni	taraf	wāle	kaise	dehni	taraf	
wāle

englishTranslationText: Among	thorn-less	lote-trees.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be	kāñte	ki	beriyoñ	meiñ

englishTranslationText: And	clusters	of	banana	plants.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	kele	ke	guch-chhoñ	meiñ

englishTranslationText: And	in	everlasting	shade.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	hamesha	ke	sāaye	meiñ

englishTranslationText: And	in	perpetually	flowing	water.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	hamesha	jāri	pāni	meiñ

englishTranslationText: And	plenty	of	fruits.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	bahut	se	mewoñ	meiñ.

englishTranslationText:
That	will	neither	finish,	nor	ever	be	
stopped.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jo	na	khatm	hoñ	aur	na	roke	jāyeñ

englishTranslationText: And	raised	couches.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	buland	bichaunoñ	meiñ

englishTranslationText: We	have	indeed	developed	these	women	with	an	excellent	development.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	hum	ne	un	aurtoñ	ko	achchhi	uthān	uthaya

englishTranslationText: So	made	them	as	maidens.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	unheiñ	banāya	kawāriyañ	apne	shauharoñ	par

englishTranslationText: The	beloved	of	their	husbands,	attractive,	of	single	age
romanUrduTranslationText: Piyāriyañ	unheiñ	piyār	dilātiyan	ek	umr	wāliyañ

englishTranslationText: For	those	on	the	right.
romanUrduTranslationText: Dehni	taraf	waloñ	ke	liye

englishTranslationText: A	large	group	from	the	earlier	generations.
romanUrduTranslationText: Agloñ	meiñ	se	ek	giroh.

englishTranslationText: And	a	large	group	from	the	latter.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	pichhloñ	meiñ	se	ek	giroh

englishTranslationText: And	those	on	the	left	–	how	(wretched)	are	those	on	the	left!
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	bāyiñ	taraf	wāle	kaise	bāyiñ	taraf	wāle

englishTranslationText: In	scorching	wind	and	boiling	hot	water.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jalti	hawa	aur	khaulte	pāni	meiñ.

englishTranslationText: And	in	the	shadow	of	a	burning	smoke.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jalte	dhuwen	ki	chhaoñ	meiñ

englishTranslationText: Which	is	neither	cool	nor	is	for	respect.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jo	na	thandi	na	‘izzat	ki.

englishTranslationText: Indeed	they	were	among	favours	before	this.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak		woh	is	se	pehle	ne'matoñ	meiñ	they	.

englishTranslationText: And	were	stubborn	upon	the	great	sin	(of	disbelief).
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	us	bade	gunah	ki	hat	(Zid)	rakhte	they.

arabicText: وَكَانُوا۟ يَقُولُونَ أَئِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًۭا وَعِظَـٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	used	to	say,	“When	we	are	dead	and	have	turned	into	dust	and	bones,	will	we	surely	
be	raised	again?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kehte	they	kya	jab	hum	mar	jāyeñ	aur	haddiyañ	aur	mitti	ho	jāyeñ	to	kya	zaroor	hum	
uthāaye	jāyeñ	ge

englishTranslationText: “And	also	our	forefathers?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	kya	hamāre	agle	bāp	dāda	bhi

englishTranslationText: Proclaim,	“Without	doubt	all	–	the	former	and	the	latter.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Tum	farmāo		ke	be-shak		sab	agle	aur	pichhle

englishTranslationText: “They	will	all	be	gathered	together	–	on	the	appointed	time	of	the	known	day.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Zaroor	ikatthe	kiye	jāyeñ	ge	ek	jāne	huwe	din	ki	mee'ād	par

englishTranslationText: Then	indeed	you,	the	astray,	the	deniers	-
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	be-shak	tum	aey	gumraho	jhutlāne	
wālo

englishTranslationText: You	will	indeed	eat	from	the	Zaqqum	tree.
romanUrduTranslationText: Zaroor	thoohad	ke	ped	meiñ	se	khāoge.

englishTranslationText: Then	will	fill	your	bellies	with	it.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	us	se	pet	bharoge

englishTranslationText:
And	upon	it,	you	will	drink	the	hot	boiling	
water.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	is	par	khaulta	pāni	piyoge

englishTranslationText: Drinking	the	way	thirsty	camels	drink.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	aisa	piyoge	jaise	sakht	piyāse	ooñt	
piyeñ

englishTranslationText:
This	is	their	reception	on	the	Day	of	
Justice.	.
romanUrduTranslationText: Yeh	unki	mehmāni	hai	insāf	ke	din.

englishTranslationText:
It	is	We	Who	created	you,	so	why	do	you	
not	accept	the	truth?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Hum	ne	tumheiñ	paida	kiya	to	tum	kyuñ	
nahi	sach	mānte

englishTranslationText:
So	what	is	your	opinion	regarding	the	
semen	you	discharge?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	bhala	dekho	to	woh	mani	jo	girāte	ho

englishTranslationText:
Do	you	make	a	human	out	of	it,	or	is	it	We	
Who	create?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kya	tum	uska	āadmi	banāte	ho	ya	hum	
banāne	wāle	haiñ

arabicText: نَحْنُ قَدَّرْنَا بَيْنَكُمُ ٱلْمَوْتَ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَسْبُوقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
It	is	We	Who	have	ordained	death	among	
you,	and	We	have	not	been	beaten	-
romanUrduTranslationText:
Hum	ne	tum	meiñ	marna	thehrāya	aur	
hum	is	se	hāre	nahi.

arabicText: عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ أَمْثَـٰلَكُمْ وَنُنشِئَكُمْ فِى مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
In	the	matter	of	exchanging	you	for	
others,	and	to	transform	you	into	what	
you	do	not	know.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ke	tum	jaise	aur	badal	deiñ	aur	tumhāri	
soorateiñ	woh	kar	deiñ	jiski	tumheiñ		
khabar	nahi

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ عَلِمْتُمُ ٱلنَّشْأَةَ ٱلْأُولَىٰ فَلَوْلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	you	have	indeed	learnt	about	the	first	
creation,	so	why	do	you	not	ponder?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak		tum	jān	chuke	ho	pehli	uthān	
phir	kyuñ	nahi	sochte

englishTranslationText:
So	what	is	your	opinion	regarding	what	
you	sow?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	bhala	batāo		to	jo	bote	ho

englishTranslationText:
Is	it	you	who	cultivate	it,	or	is	it	We	Who	
develop	it?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kya	tum	uski	kheti	banāte	ho	ya	hum	
banāne	wāle	haiñ

arabicText: لَوْ نَشَآءُ لَجَعَلْنَـٰهُ حُطَـٰمًۭا فَظَلْتُمْ تَفَكَّهُونَ
englishTranslationText:
If	We	will	We	can	make	it	like	dry	
trampled	hay,	so	you	would	keep	crying	
out.
romanUrduTranslationText: Hum	chāheñ	to	usey	rauñdan	(Pa-māl)	kar	deiñ	phir	tum	bāteiñ	banāte	reh	jāo

englishTranslationText: That,	“We	have	indeed	been	penalised!”
romanUrduTranslationText: Ke	hum	par	chatti	padi	(Tāwān)

englishTranslationText: “In	fact,	we	were	unfortunate!”
romanUrduTranslationText: Balke	hum	be-naseeb	rahe.

englishTranslationText: So	what	is	your	opinion	regarding	the	water	that	you	drink?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	bhala	batāo	to	woh	pāni	jo	peete	ho.

arabicText: ءَأَنتُمْ أَنزَلْتُمُوهُ مِنَ ٱلْمُزْنِ أَمْ نَحْنُ ٱلْمُنزِلُونَ
englishTranslationText: Is	it	you	who	caused	it	to	descend	from	the	cloud,	or	is	it	We	Who	cause	it	to	descend?
romanUrduTranslationText: Kya	tum	ne	isey	bādal	se	utāra	ya	hum	haiñ	utārne	wāle

arabicText: لَوْ نَشَآءُ جَعَلْنَـٰهُ أُجَاجًۭا فَلَوْلَا تَشْكُرُونَ
englishTranslationText: If	We	will	We	can	make	it	bitter,	so	why	do	you	not	give	thanks?
romanUrduTranslationText: Hum	chāheñ	to	isey	khāri	kar	deiñ	phir	kyuñ	nahi	shukr	karte

englishTranslationText: So	what	is	your	opinion	regarding	the	fire	which	you	kindle?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	bhala	batāo	to	woh	āag		jo	tum	raushan	karte	ho

arabicText: ءَأَنتُمْ أَنشَأْتُمْ شَجَرَتَهَآ أَمْ نَحْنُ ٱلْمُنشِـُٔونَ
englishTranslationText: Is	it	you	who	grew	its	tree,	or	is	it	We	Who	create?
romanUrduTranslationText: Kya	tum	ne	uska	ped	paida	kiya	ya	hum	haiñ	paida	karne	wāle

englishTranslationText: We	have	made	it	as	a	reminder	of	hell	and	as	a	utility	for	travellers	in	the	jungle
romanUrduTranslationText: Hum	ne	usey	Jahannam	ka	yād	gār	banaya	aur	jungal	meiñ	musafiroñ	ka	fāida

englishTranslationText:
Therefore	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	-	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him)	proclaim	the	Purity	of	
the	name	of	your	Lord,	the	Greatest.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	aey	Mehboob!	Tum	pāki	bolo	apne	‘azmat	wāle	Rab	ke	nām	ki.

englishTranslationText: So	I	swear	by	the	setting	places	of	the	stars.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	mujhe	qasam	hai	un	jaghoñ	ki	jahāñ	tāre	doobte	haiñ

englishTranslationText: And	that	is	indeed	a	tremendous	oath,	if	you	understand.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	tum	samjho	to	yeh	badi	qasam	hai.

englishTranslationText: This	is	indeed	the	noble	Qur’an.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak		yeh	‘izzat	wāla	Qur’ān	hai

englishTranslationText: Kept	in	a	secure	Book.
romanUrduTranslationText: Mehfooz	nawishte	meiñ

englishTranslationText: None	may	touch	it,	except	with	ablution.
romanUrduTranslationText: Isey	na	chhuweñ	magar	ba-	wazu

englishTranslationText: Sent	down	by	the	Lord	Of	The	Creation.
romanUrduTranslationText: Utāra	huwa	hai	sāre	jahān	ke	Rab	ka

englishTranslationText:
So	is	this	the	matter	regarding	which	you	
laze?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	kya	is	bāt	meiñ	tum	susti	karte	ho

englishTranslationText: And	you	make	its	denial	your	share?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	apna	hissa	yeh	rakhte	ho	ke	jhutlāte	
ho

englishTranslationText:
So	why	was	it	not,	when	the	soul	reaches	
up	to	the	throat,	-
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	kyuñ	na	ho	ke	jab	jān	gale	tak	
pahuñche.

englishTranslationText: Whereas	you	watch	at	that	moment!
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	tum	us	waqt	dekh	rahe	ho.

arabicText: وَنَحْنُ أَقْرَبُ إِلَيْهِ مِنكُمْ وَلَـٰكِن لَّا تُبْصِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	are	nearer	to	him	than	you	are,	
but	you	cannot	see.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	hum	uske	ziyada	pās	haiñ	tum	se	
magar	tumheiñ		nigah	nahi

englishTranslationText:
So	why	is	it	not,	that	if	you	are	not	to	be	
repaid,
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	kyuñ	na	huwa	agar	tumheiñ	badla	
milna	nahi

englishTranslationText: That	you	bring	it	back,	if	you	are	truthful?
romanUrduTranslationText: Ke	usey	lauta	lāte	agar	tum	sachche	ho

englishTranslationText:
Then	if	the	dying	one	is	of	those	having	
proximity,	-
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	woh	marne	wāla	agar	muqarraboñ	se	
hai

englishTranslationText:
Then	is	relief,	and	flowers	–	and	Gardens	
of	peace.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	rāhat	hai	aur	phool	aur	chainke	bāgh

arabicText: وَأَمَّآ إِن كَانَ مِنْ أَصْحَـٰبِ ٱلْيَمِينِ
englishTranslationText: And	if	he	is	of	those	on	the	right,	-
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	agar	dehni	taraf	waloñ		se	ho

englishTranslationText:
Then	upon	you	is	the	greetings	of	peace	(O 
dear Prophet Muhammad – peace and 
blessings be upon him),	from	those	on	the	
right.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	aey	Mehboob!	Tum	par	Salām	ho	dehni	
taraf	waloñ		se

arabicText: وَأَمَّآ إِن كَانَ مِنَ ٱلْمُكَذِّبِينَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ
englishTranslationText: And	if	he	is	from	the	deniers,	the	astray,
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	jhutlāne	waloñ	gumrāhoñ	meiñ	
se	ho

englishTranslationText:
Then	his	reception	is	the	hot	boiling	
water.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	uski	mehmāni	khaulta	pāni.

englishTranslationText: And	a	casting	into	the	blazing	fire.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	bhadakti	āg	meiñ	dhañsāna

englishTranslationText: This	is	indeed	an	utmost	certainty.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	be-shak	a’ala	daraje	ki	yaqeeni	bāt	
hai.

englishTranslationText:
Therefore	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	-	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him)	proclaim	the	Purity	of	
the	name	of	your	Lord,	the	Greatest.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	aey	Mehboob!	Tum	apne	‘azmat	wāle	Rab	ke	nām	ki	pāki	bolo.
